intro: Succisa pratensis, commonly known as meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright, slender stems and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive serrated edge, while its flowers bloom from June to August. Succisa pratensis is often found in sunny to partially shaded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
